blackdoor.util

Class HistoricSHE

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackdoor.util.HistoricSHE
  • Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public class HistoricSHE
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    kAG0 a class containing simple static implementations of secure but non-standardized encryption algorithms just SHE for now actually Recommended usage: large inputs | stream cipher: create an instance of SHE and pass blocks to calculateSHEBlock, pass the final block to claculateFinalSHEBlock. small inputs: just call doSHE

                byte[] key)
        Deprecated. 
        Calculate a single block with SimpleHashEncryption (see doSHE for details)
        Parameters:

        key - a 128 bit or stronger key
        Returns:

      • doSHE

        public static Crypto.EncryptionResult doSHE(byte[] input,
                            byte[] key)
        Deprecated. 
        Simple/Secure Hash Encryption encryption/decryption method which uses the identical nature of the encryption and decryption algorithms in the counter (CTR) mode of operation for block ciphers to use a one way hash function instead of a typical encryption algorithm. SHE uses SHA256 with a 256bit block size, and a key of at least 126 bits and a generated IV of 256 bits. This method operates as a block cipher,
        Parameters:
        input - The text to calculate, must be less that 2GB or 2^32 bytes, due to array restrictions in java.
        key - The key to use for encryption/decryption, must be at least 128 bits.
        Returns:
        An EncryptionResult containing the iv and calculated text.

      • doSHE

        public static Crypto.EncryptionResult doSHE(byte[] input,
                            byte[] key,
                            byte[] IV)
        Deprecated. 
        Simple/Secure Hash Encryption encryption/decryption method which uses the identical nature of the encryption and decryption algorithms in the counter (CTR) mode of operation for block ciphers to use a one way hash function instead of a typical encryption algorithm. SHE uses SHA256 with a 256bit block size, and a key of at least 126 bits and an IV of at least 256 bits. This method operates as a block cipher,
        Parameters:
        input - The text to calculate, must be less that 2GB or 2^32 bytes, due to array restrictions in java.
        key - The key to use for encryption/decryption, must be at least 128 bits.
        IV - The initializaiton vector to use, must be at least 256 bits.
        Returns:
        An EncryptionResult containing the iv and calculated text.
